name: Royal Institute of International Affairs
goal:
Chatham House, the Royal Institute of International Affairs, is a world-leading policy institute based in London. Its mission is to help governments and societies build a sustainably secure, prosperous and just world. To do so, the institute:

- engages governments, the private sector, civil society and its members in open debates and private discussions about the most significant developments in international affairs;

- carries out independent and rigorous analysis of critical global, regional and country-specific challenges and opportunities;

- develops new ideas and proposes policies on how best to confront these challenges and take advantage of these opportunities from the near- to the long-term, and

- seeks to connect its analysis and ideas with as wide an audience as possible so as to build momentum for change
interests: Banking and financial services, Climate Action, Economy, finance and the euro, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Migration and asylum, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trade, Trans-European Networks
